description: NPR investigated a crypto scam company known as SpireBit, which stole hundreds of thousands of dollars from Russian-speaking seniors. Now, some of the victims are getting their money back after a lawsuit by Massachusetts authorities.
title: A victim of a crypto ‘pig butchering’ scam just got his $140,000 back

description: President Biden told reporters he was confident the election “will be free and fair,” before saying, “I don’t know whether it will be peaceful.”
title: Biden says he is worried about violence around the presidential election

description: The U.N. has adopted a lengthy "pact" of items for the world to address for a better tomorrow. We asked global thinkers if they'd like to add anything or give more emphasis to certain agenda items.
title: What about Grandmas? Global thinkers assess the U.N. 'Summit of the Future'

description: The justices, in a break from the way they have handled most such cases in the recent past, told the challengers to first litigate their claims in the U.S. Court of Appeals for the District of Columbia.
title: Supreme Court refuses, for now, to block new EPA rules to fight climate change

description: “Our lexicographers monitor a huge range of sources to select which words and definitions to add,” Merriam-Webster's Peter Sokolowski said. These sources range from academic journals to social media.
title: ‘Touch grass,’ ‘For You page’: See 200 new words and phrases added to Merriam-Webster

description: Many of Helene’s effects are individual and heartbreaking, such as the deaths of children, grandparents and others. But the storm's impact is also so outsized that it’s clearly visible from space.
title: The scale of Helene’s devastating impacts are eye-popping, even from space

description: Remnants of Hurricane Helene shut down a North Carolina factory that supplies critical IV fluids to hospitals across the country. There's no timeline for when production will resume at the facility.
title: Storm damage closes N.C. factory that makes vital hospital supplies

description: U.S. employers added more than a quarter million jobs in September, while the unemployment rate fell to 4.1%.  Here's what to know about the data.
title: The U.S. saw stunningly strong growth in jobs last month. Here's what to know

description: Wisconsin has long been a presidential swing state, but thanks to new maps, it's now also a potential swing state for the legislature for the first time in 15 years.
title: In swing-state Wisconsin, new districts threaten the GOP hold on the Legislature

description: Arab Americans have been frustrated with the Biden administration’s response to the ongoing war in Gaza and the expanding conflict into Lebanon.
title: Harris is meeting with a group of Arab Americans in Michigan today

description: Around 30 missiles appear to have landed around Nevatim Air Base in Southern Israel, although damage was limited.
title: Satellite images show dozens of Iranian missiles struck near Israeli Air Base

description: With one in 10 potential voters being a naturalized citizen, the group has enormous political power, especially in key swing states like Pennsylvania, where nearly 80% of those Americans plan to vote.
title: 'New American voters have the power to sway the outcome' in Pennsylvania and beyond

description: A golden trophy and pot of prize money worth more than $100,000 was hidden in a forest recently. So of course I joined in the hunt.
title: I went on a real life treasure hunt. This is what I discovered

description: The November election in Arizona could determine whether a rapidly expanding school voucher program is reined in by the Legislature. That's the goal Democrats have -- if they can get a majority.
title: School vouchers are one example of the stakes in legislative elections

description: Dockworkers suspended their strike yesterday, avoiding an "economic crisis," but a sticking point remains in negotiations. And, Tyre Nichols trial verdict brings hope for police brutality cases.
title: Dockworkers suspend strike. And, Tyre Nichols' family applauds trial verdict

description: Lillie Cunningham recently celebrated her 110th birthday. She has lived through two pandemics and two world wars and is looking forward to voting in November's presidential election.
title: At 110 years old, an Alabama woman credits one thing for her long life: faith

description: In 2015 Stewart Billie moved his family from the city back to tribal land in the Navajo Nation. Billie’s sons found the lack of noise unnerving until their dad replaced the quiet with heavy metal.
title: A dad and his 2 teenage sons loved heavy metal so much they started a band: Narbona

description: Devastation left by Hurricane Helene. Escalated tensions in the Middle East. The Harris campaign is navigating a pair of October surprises as Election Day draws closer.
title: The October surprise: Harris is navigating a pair of them

description: NPR visits the Sikh Temple of Wisconsin in Oak Creek, where a white supremacist mass shooting took place 12 years ago.
title: We visited a Sikh temple that sits at the intersection of multiple election issues

description: They debated, they wrote memoirs, they got inaugurated, they turned 100. What else did political people do? Plus: wildlife's gonna wildlife
title: Why did Tim Walz call himself a 'knucklehead' this week? Find out in the quiz

description: The latest strikes came after Israel warned people to evacuate communities in southern Lebanon that are outside a United Nations-declared buffer zone.
title: Israeli airstrikes cut off a key crossing between Lebanon and Syria

description:
Tuesday night, JD Vance and Tim Walz faced off in their first debate. Host Brittany Luse is joined by NPR's national race and identity correspondent Sandhya Dirks and political correspondent Danielle Kurtzleben to discuss how the candidates display competing brands of white masculinity.

Then, Fat Bear Week is back! The annual March Madness-style bracket of the fattest bears in Alaska's Katmai National Park is in full swing after a rocky start. In honor of Fat Bear Week, Brittany revisits a journey through time to unpack what bears mean to us — and why they're family, friend and foe all at once.
title: The 'reddit bro' vs. the 'wife guy'; plus, Fat Bear Week!

description: The governor of the South Kivu province said the death toll was provisional and the number of fatalities could rise further. He said there were 278 people on board, according to local authorities.
title: At least 78 people dead after boat capsizes in eastern Congo, official says
